job title: Lead Data Scientist - Data Science Optimization
job description:
Description:

Join Targets Data Science and
Optimization team which is a multi-disciplinary team of people skilled in
statistics, optimization, machine-learning, operations research, distributed
systems, compilers, and functional programming.
This is an exciting opportunity where you will:

1.
Research techniques and prototype telemetry tools to detect
anomalies in supply chain performance and diagnose their root causes.

2.
Embed with business teams and understand the supply chain
processes to inform the design of these telemetry tools.

3.
Partner with a multi-disciplinary team of technologists to develop
and implement these tools to work at scale.

4.
Test and learn to influence and drive the creation of new methods
and best practices in the use of statistical data modeling and machine learning
techniques in a big data environment to build these telemetry tools for
Targets supply chain operations.

It's a very large and interesting
problem that we have fun thinking through and solving.We'd love to hear from you if you are interested
in the role that calls for a combination of statistical data analysis,
mathematical modelling, programming with Python/R and good software
engineering. Domain expertise in supply chain operations isnt necessary; we'll
happily teach you that! We emphasize both learning and teaching within the
group, we're excited to teach you and to learn from you!

Why work with us at Target?
  • We are a distributed team. Our company is based in Minneapolis, MN. Our team is
    based in Minneapolis, MN and we have partner teams at Sunnyvale, CA and
    Bangalore, India and many that work outside these areas.
  • We are using great tools! We write a lot of code using Python/R/Haskell/Scala
    and are trying to push Nix into new directions. We get to be clients on Targets well-run
    Kubernetes infrastructure.
  • We love open source! Many
    of our team members contribute to open source communities and get to do it
    during work time. We try to contribute back to our communities where we can
    and are grateful to be able to open source some of our own projects!
  • We value diversity. We
    believe that diversity and inclusion is of core importance when try to create
    positive in-store experiences for our guests, and we think it is also
    critically important when building our teams.
  • We value our team members. We treat our team members like people, not like
    cogs in a machine. We value our team members for who they are, not just
    what they can get done. We are parents, hobbyists, enthusiasts, family
    members, and community members, and are able to offer flexibility to our
    team members' schedules and work arrangements so that they can flourish
    both inside and outside of work.
What we are looking for:
  • Evidence of strong data analysis and fundamental
    statistical modeling skills
  • Experience using Python/R/SQL working in a data rich environment
  • A strong quantitatively oriented advanced degree with a
    passion for empirical research and mathematical thinking
  • Very good client facing skills, excellent written and
    verbal communication skills
  • Interest in continuous learning across different
    fields, especially statistics, optimization, econometrics, functional
    programming, clean software engineering and of course supply chain
    operations in omni-channel retailing!
Qualifications:
